author: eth2_gitter_bot
content:
<vbuterin> So a quick update on where we've thought since then:
* It turns out that while updating the *commitment* after a state update is easy, updating *witnesses* is hard. You pretty much need to do O(N) work to recompute all the witnesses
* A reasonable max state size to target would be something like 2**36 to 2**48, and even the aggressive lower bound is larger than any reasonable trusted setup. Hence, we need some kind of multi-layer structure.
* And it turns out that multi-layer structures make witness updates easier!
Hence our interest in verkle trees now
